answer:
The answer is:

Lucille Ball was an American actress, comedian, and producer. She was born in Jamestown, New York, on August 5, 1904. Ball was best known for her role as Lucy Ricardo in the television series I Love Lucy. Ball was a pioneer in the television industry and was a recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom.
